inspect.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it
inspect.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
The police will inspect the venue for safety.
inspect.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make an official visit to a building, organization etc to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed
inspect.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The building is regularly inspected by the fire-safety officer.
General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
inspect.translation[0].definitions[1].no: In everyday English, people usually say take a look at something or someone or, in British English, have a look at something or someone rather than inspect something or someone:
Can I take a look at your ticket, please?
inspect.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to check something officially to see whether it is of the right standard or quality, or whether it is safe to use
inspect.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The engines are all inspected before they leave the factory.
inspect.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to visit a factory or other building to check that everything is satisfactory and all the rules are being obeyed
inspect.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Petrochemical plants have to be inspected regularly by the Labor Department.
